Class Box3D

java.lang.Object
Box3D
public class Box3D extends Object
Maman 12 - Box3D. This class represents a three-dimensional box The box is represented by its lower-left-front point and three integers for the length (x axis), width (y axis) and height (z axis) of the box. the box dimensions must be equal or greater than 1.
Version:
2024b
Author:
Or Koren

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    Box3D()
    Constructs and initializes a box with a default base point and all dimensions to 1

    Constructs and initializes a box object from a given base point and 3 integers as the dimentions of the Box
    Box3D(Point3D p, int length, int width, int height)
    Constructs and initializes a Box3D object from a given Box3D

      Constructs and initializes a box with a default base point and all dimensions to 1

    • Box3D

      public Box3D(Point3D p, int length, int width, int height)
      Constructs and initializes a Box3D object from a given Box3D
      Parameters:
      p - point object that represent the base point of the box
      length - the length of the box
      width - the width of the box
      height - the height of the box

      Constructs and initializes a box object from a given base point and 3 integers as the dimentions of the Box
      Parameters:
      other - Box3D object to be copied into the new Box3D object

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a string representation of this Box3D object
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a string representation of this box containing the location of its base point in the coordinate space and its dimensions in the follwing foramt: The base point is (x,x,x), length = x, width = x, height= x

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Box3D other)
      Determines whether or not the two boxes are equal
      Parameters:
      other - a Box3D object to be compared with this Box3D
      Returns:
      true if the Box3D object to be compared has the same values; false otherwise

    • move

      public Box3D move(double dx, double dy, double dz)
      Moves the box in the (x,y,z) coordinate system to (x+dx,y+dy,z+dz) without changing the box dimensions
      Parameters:
      dx - the addtion for coordinate x value
      dy - the addtion for coordinate y value
      dz - the addtion for coordinate z value
      Returns:
      the new box in its new location

      public double distance(Box3D other)
      Computes the distance between two boxes based on the distance of their center points
      Parameters:

      Returns:
      the distance between two Box3D objects
